result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin J. Cunningham was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waupaca County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to maintain full-time education or find and maintain full-time employment, or a combination of either. 
Any week defendant is not engaged in full-time education and/or employment, to perform 2 hours community service work.

Defendant shall not possess any illegal drugs or substances/drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961. 
Defendant shall not go upon any premises where he/she has cause to believe such contraband as defined in Ch. 961 may be present. 
Defendant shall not associate with individuals in possession of illegal substances or drug paraphernalia.
Defendant's record shall be expunged per Section 973.015 Wis Stats if probation is successfully completed.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC. 
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations. 
Defendant shall possess prescription medications only by valid prescription, and take in the manner and method as prescribed by a physician. 
Defendant to not terminate any medical treatment or prescriptions without physician's consent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Time served.  
Granted release privileges under 303.08(1).
